Description: Oval bowl of rough straw-tempered Nile silt pottery with a slight platform base, flaring sides and a rounded lip that rise unevenly. Incised post-firing on the interior at one end with a U shaped potmark. Interior smoothed and coated with self-slip. Fire cloud on interior.
Curator's comments: Marked U on the side. Like Fancy ware F19a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
